elements.title: Nodes
elements.description: NODES is the independent marketplace for a sustainable energy future where grid owners, producers and consumers of energy can trade decentralised flexibility and energy. Similar to Piclo

elements.title: Blueprint power
elements.description: Blueprint believes that buildings play a critical role in the global energy transition towards carbon-free power and want to transform buildings into flexible power networks that help secure access to reliable, clean energy for cities and communities. A [BP Launchpad](https://www.bp.com/en/global/corporate/news-and-insights/press-releases/bp-to-grow-leading-us-technology-company-that-turns-commercial-buildings-into-virtual-power-plants.html) company

elements.title: Recurve
elements.description: Recurve connects the dots between efficiency, electrification, renewable energy, and DERs to enable demand flexibility to become a market-based procurable resource. In Nexuslabs podcast, developed the opensource [eemeter](http://eemeter.openee.io/) measuring and validation tool

elements.title: Logical Buildings
elements.description: Logical Buildings is a smart building software and solutions company for Multifamily and Commercial real estate managers to reduce energy and operating costs, achieve sustainability goals and improve tenant comfort. Raised $10M [in Dec 2021](https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20211209005298/en/) to expand their VPP software

elements.title: Enegen
elements.description: Enegen Power Systems (formally Dunstan Thomas Energy division) is a leading U.K. based provider of scheduling, wholesale and Balancing Mechanism dispatch and commercial optimisation software

elements.title: Energy Web
elements.description: Energy Web (EW) is a global nonprofit organization accelerating a low-carbon, customer-centric electricity system.  EW focuses on building core infrastructure and shared technology. After launching their enterprise blockchain platform tailored to the energy sector in 2019, EW’s technology roadmap has since grown into the Energy Web Decentralized Operating System (EW-DOS), a full stack that includes front-end applications and a variety of software development toolkits.

elements.title: RETScreen
elements.description: Implemented by the Canadian government, RETScreen® Clean Energy Management Software platform enables low-carbon planning, implementation, monitoring and reporting.

elements.title: Kraken Flex
elements.description: Distributed Energy Resource Management System, used to be Upside energy

elements.title: OakTree power
elements.description: Offering Flexibility services for buildings to generate revenue streams. Based in London

elements.title: GridX
elements.description: We connect distributed energy resources on a single platform. We optimize energy flows to make the most efficient use of energy. Based in Munich

elements.title: Sympower
elements.description: We help you unlock the value of your flexibility. We do this with electric assets across industries. In March 21 they've raised 5.2M in series B, from [Tech.eu](https://tech.eu/brief/amsterdam-based-sympower-powers-up-with-e5-2-million-investment-in-series-b-round/)

elements.title: Argand solutions
elements.description: Devon based Argand enable renewables and / or energy storage to connect to the Grid and these assets to then perform optimally through better data and analysis. [GridMAP](https://www.argandsolutions.com/gridmap-optimum-energy-storage-modelling) provides pre & post-project modelling and optimisation analysis for solar PV, wind, CHP and energy storage systems.

elements.title: Field energy formerly Virmati Energy
elements.description: Virmati Energy was founded by Amit Gudka, one of the co-founder of Bulb. Virmati Energy wants to show that batteries are a totally viable part of our energy infrastructure with a portfolio of batteries in the UK. In the news Feb 21 from [BusinessGreen](https://www.businessgreen.com/news/4027455/bulb-founder-steps-focus-battery-storage-venture) and on [Sifted in Nov 21](https://sifted.eu/articles/bulb-collapse-shareholder-losses-investors/) after Bulb's collapse. Raised [10M in Aug 2021](https://www.solarpowerportal.co.uk/news/field_unveils_160mw_storage_pipeline_following_10m_fundraise) to deploy 160MW of grid-scale storage

elements.title: Arenko
elements.description: Optimisation of technical and commercial performance of flexible assets in real time. Arenko underwent a significant transformation in July 2020, selling its only battery storage asset and transitioning into the software sector entirely. from [Current News](https://www.current-news.co.uk/blogs/a-pure-play-software-company-arenkos-rupert-newland-on-flexibility-and-the-new-battery-markets)

elements.title: Levelise
elements.description: Oxford based Levelise developed a home energy management system that links domestic battery systems to a suite of algorithmic controls

elements.title: Eel power
elements.description: Eel power have background in solar PV, large scale hydropower and in commercial energy storage co-located at renewable generation sites in the UK. Partnered in Feb 2021 with EDF to optimise 80MW of storage, from [Current News](https://www.current-news.co.uk/news/eelpower-selects-edf-to-optimise-80mw-of-battery-storage)

elements.title: David Energy
elements.description: A retail electricity supplier vertically integrated and powered by technology. We bring electricity supply and demand response together. [Announced](https://news.crunchbase.com/news/david-energy-announces-19m-to-store-and-deploy-power/) $19 million in funding in Feb 21, which included a $4.1 million seed round and an additional $15 million in capital

elements.title: Pearl Street Technologies
elements.description: Suite of Unified Grid Analyses with Renewables (SUGAR) is a simulation, optimization, and design platform for power grid planning, with applications for grid operators, utilities, project developers, and consultants. Backed by Powerhouse Ventures

elements.title: Future Grid
elements.description: Melbourne based Future Grid’s software turns smart meter data into improved grid reliability, asset management and customer safety so that Utilities can deliver safe and reliable electricity. Free Electrons alumni

elements.title: V2G uk trial
elements.description: geo are leading a BEIS funded consortium  that’s enabling domestic demand-side-response through our Hybrid Home in 24 UK homes.

elements.title: Fluence
elements.description: Fluence is the result of two industry powerhouses and pioneers in energy storage joining together to form a new company dedicated to innovating modern electric infrastructure. In January 2018, [Siemens](https://www.siemens.com/global/en/home/products/energy.html) and [AES](http://www.aes.com/home/default.aspx) launched Fluence. In Jan 2021 the Qatar Investment Authority is investing $125 million into them, [from TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2020/12/30/fluence-the-energy-storage-systems-developer-is-now-worth-over-1-billion-after-qia-investment/)

elements.title: Ohm Connect
elements.description: OhmHours are energy saving events, usually an hour in length, in which OhmConnect has committed to the grid that our users (you!) will save energy. From [CNBC](https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/07/alphabet-backed-sidewalk-bets-on-getting-customers-to-cut-energy-use-.html): received $100 million from Alphabet-backed [Sidewalk Infrastructure Partners](https://sidewalkinfra.com/) to build the largest distributed clean power plant in North America. SIP invested $20 million in OhmConnect directly, with the additional $80 million going towards building a virtual power plant

elements.title: Nikola Power
elements.description: Nikola Power is building a software infrastructure which seamlessly integrates and manages millions of distributed energy resources.

elements.title: Starling Energy Group
elements.description: Perth based Starling Energy Group provides integrated energy asset management services that help households, businesses and energy utilities transition to cleaner, greener renewable energy and end their reliance on traditional fossil power.

elements.title: Stem
elements.description: Stem builds and operates the largest digitally connected energy storage network for our customers. Our world class AI platform optimizes the value of our customers' energy assets and facilitates their participation in energy markets, yielding economic and resiliency benefits while accelerating renewable adoption. Athena accurately forecasts energy demand onsite and energy demand on the grid. From [Reuters](https://www.reuters.com/article/stem-ma-star-peak-energy/stem-agrees-blank-check-merger-with-star-peak-to-go-public-idUSL8N2IJ5K5): In December 2020 has agreed to go public by merging with blank-check acquisition company [Star Peak Energy](https://www.starpeakcorp.com/home/default.aspx) Transition Corp at a valuation of roughly $1.35 billion.

elements.title: Zenobe
elements.description: London based Zenobe lower the risk to our clients by eliminating the upfront capital cost and providing the storage as a service. We install, maintain and operate the storage assets so our clients can focus on running their businesses.

elements.title: National Grid upgrades balancing mechanism tech
elements.description: Sept 2020 - In launching the new API, National Grid ESO aims to make it easier for smaller assets such as batteries and small distributed generators to bid into the Balancing Mechanism

elements.title: Geli
elements.description: Geli, which stands for Growing Energy Labs, Inc., provides software and business solutions for designing, automating, and managing energy storage and microgrid systems.

elements.title: Vector NZ
elements.description: New Zealand's largest distributor of electricity and gas. Vector and Amazon Web Services (AWS) are jointly developing a New Energy Platform (NEP) under a multi-year strategic alliance to change how energy is managed, delivered and consumed.

elements.title: Peak Power
elements.description: Peak Power is a global energy technology services provider based in Toronto focused on delivering intelligent software and project solutions to offset the most expensive hours of electric demand for both utilities and building owners.

elements.title: kiwipower
elements.description: Kiwi Power’s distributed energy platform simply and reliably unlocks flexibility from Distributed Energy Resources (DERs) to maximise their value.

elements.title: Open Energi
elements.description: Open Energi automate and optimise a network of distributed energy resources to reduce energy costs and provide flexible capacity to enable a 100% renewable energy system. They are in the [BP Launchpad portfolio](https://bplaunchpad.com/portfolio)

elements.title: StorageVET and DER-VET
elements.description: The Electric Power Research Institute [EPRI](https://www.epri.com/about) conducts research, development, and demonstration projects for the benefit of the public in the United States and internationally. StorageVET 2.1 facilitates the understanding of where to place and install energy storage, the optimum size as well as controls options. [DER-VET™](https://www.der-vet.com/) is a publicly available, open-source, optimization-based energy valuation and planning tool for distributed energy resources (DER) and larger, centralized energy resources

elements.title: Camus energy
elements.description: Camus energy sylicon valley startup developing a platform (allegedly open source) for ancillary services and real-time trading

elements.title: Voltus
elements.description: Voltus Demand side response and energy efficiency platform

elements.title: Enbala
elements.description: Enbala Vancouver + Denver based platform for virtual power plant and DSR optimisation

elements.title: Opus one
elements.description: Opus one Toronto based, DER and DSR platform

elements.title: Faraday grid
elements.description: Faraday grid, Edinburgh based, [backed by WeWork co-founder](https://theenergyst.com/faraday-grid-lands-25m-investment/) and Amp Energy [went bust in 2019](). Intended to provide hardware + software for DER

elements.title: Upside energy
elements.description: Upside energy Cloud software for demand side response with AI. Has become Kraken Flex

elements.title: Piclo
elements.description: Piclo, Grid flexibility marketplace Platform, similar to [Nodes](https://nodesmarket.com/).

elements.title: Leap
elements.description: Leap Off-peak energy trading platform, funded by national grid

elements.title: Smarter Grid solutions
elements.description: Smarter Grid solutions working with Distribution Utilities, System Operators and Energy Asset Operators to seamlessly and effortlessly integrate DER assets to the grid, and energy and flexibility markets.

elements.title: Green Sync
elements.description: Green Sync is Australia’s home grown demand-side management provider. Offering a range of products, above all worth mentioning the energy marketplace [deX](https://dex.energy/)

elements.title: Tibber
elements.description: Tibber discovered that electricity customers found the offerings from traditional electricity utilities boring, expensive and very complex. The platform automates the process of buying electricity from distributors when it's cheaper and organises consumption for efficiency (assumptions based on descriptions found on website)

elements.title: Kaluza
elements.description: Kaluza is OVO Group’s technology platform ecosystem that is driving the transition to a zero carbon grid. Its software platforms enable energy suppliers to empower their customers with unique digital experiences and smart, low carbon technologies

elements.title: Tesla's Autobidder
elements.description: Autobidder is a real-time trading and control platform that provides value-based asset management and portfolio optimization, enabling owners and operators to configure operational strategies that maximize revenue according to their business objectives and risk preferences.

elements.title: Tesla's Opticaster
elements.description: Opticaster is Tesla’s intelligent software designed to maximize economic benefits and sustainability objectives for distributed energy resources.

elements.title: GridBeyond
elements.description: GridBeyond enables participation in Demand Side Response, including grid revenue programmes and enhanced energy savings through peak avoidance and trading. Winners of BusinessGreen [Tech Awards 2019](https://gridbeyond.com/gridbeyond-wins-smart-grid-technology-of-the-year-award-at-businessgreen-technology-awards-2019/) in the Smart Grid category
